Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bibiano Nmi Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc., a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(b).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's Prison Inmate funds are to be applied to restitution and Court financial obligations owed, per prison policy
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with the victim, her family or anyone under the age of 18

No Computers or devices that will give the defendant access to the Internet without approval of the PO
.

The defendant is to be on Life Time Sex Offender Registry - def is to comply with all rules and conditions of the Sex Offender Registry

Complete Sex Offender assessment and follow-through with all treatment recommended

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay restitution - to be held open for 3 years;  If needed, can be reassessed

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to DA's office

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Extended Supervision on Cts 2, 3 & 4 of this case are the same as conditions on Ct 1 of this case
.

from Atty Joseph Ehmann    re: Per Rule 809.30(4)(b) Atty Ehmann is writing in response to Motion to Withdraw filed by SPD-apptd Atty Hunt.  The rule requires that SPD "determine whether successor counsel will be apptd" & notify CRT of the determination.  The Judge is required to consider this response prior to ruling of withdrawal motion.  The SPD informs the CRT that if the Motion to w/draw Atty Hunt is granted the SPD will appt successor counsel
